ALAPPUZHA

Alappuzha, also known as Alleppey, is a district in the south-western part of Kerala that offers a variety of attractions for tourists. It is a place where you can enjoy the natural beauty, the historical heritage, and the cultural diversity of Kerala. Here are some of the tourist attractions in Alappuzha district that you can visit:

Kuttanad Backwaters: Kuttanad, also known as the “Rice Bowl of Kerala” is one of the main attractions in Alappuzha. It is rich with its scenic view of paddy fields and backwaters. You can enjoy a cruise on a traditional houseboat, or a kettuvallam, and witness the rural life, lush greenery, and diverse wildlife along the banks. You can also visit the nearby villages, temples, churches, and markets

Krishnapuram Palace: This is a historically important palace and museum, built by the ruler of Kayamkulam, Marthanda Varma, in the 18th century. The palace is a fine example of the Kerala style of architecture, and has a wooden structure, with intricate carvings and paintings. The museum displays various artifacts, weapons, and costumes related to the history and culture of Kayamkulam. The palace also has a mural painting of Gajendra Moksham, which is the largest of its kind in Kerala

Pathiramanal Island: This is a small and beautiful island on the Vembanad Lake, and a paradise for birdwatchers and nature lovers. The island is accessible by boat, and has a rich biodiversity. You can find over 90 species of birds, such as cormorants, herons, egrets, and terns, as well as various plants, flowers, and butterflies. The island also offers a stunning view of the sunrise and the sunset

Alappuzha Beach: This is one of the most popular beaches in Kerala, with golden sand, clear water, and coconut palms. You can sunbathe, swim, surf, or indulge in some adventure sports at this beach, or simply enjoy the sunset and the sea breeze. The beach also has a sculpture garden, a children’s park, and a war memorial nearby. The beach is also the venue for the annual sand art festival, which showcases the creativity and talent of the sand artists
